<span style="font-size: xx-small;"><strong>Hocus pocus</strong>&nbsp;is a generic term that may be derived from an ancient language and is currently used by&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magician_(illusion)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Magician (illusion)">magicians</a>, usually the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic_word" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Magic word">magic words</a>&nbsp;spoken when bringing about some sort of change. <div dir="auto">
</div>
<div dir="auto">
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The earliest known&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/English_language" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="English language">English-language</a>&nbsp;work on magic, or what was then known as&nbsp;<em><a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legerdemain" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Legerdemain">legerdemain</a></em>&nbsp;(sleight of hand), was published anonymously in 1635 under the title&nbsp;<em>Hocus Pocus Junior: The Anatomie of Legerdemain</em>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-1"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hocus_pocus_(magic)#cite_note-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup>&nbsp;Further research suggests that "Hocus Pocus" was the stage name of a well known magician of the era. This may be William Vincent, who is recorded as having been granted a license to perform magic in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/England" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="England">England</a>&nbsp;in 1619.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-2"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hocus_pocus_(magic)#cite_note-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup>&nbsp;Whether he was the author of the book is unknown.</span></div>

<div>

<div>
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The origins of the term remain obscure. The most popular conjecture is that it is a garbled Latin religious phrase or some form of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dog_Latin" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Dog Latin">'dog' Latin</a>. Some have associated it with similar-sounding fictional, mythical, or legendary names. Others dismiss it as merely a combination of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nonsense_word" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Nonsense word">nonsense words</a>.</span></div>
<div>
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">However, Czechs do understand clearly at least half of the term -&nbsp;<em>pokus</em>&nbsp;means "attempt" or "experiment" in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Czech_language" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Czech language">Czech</a>. Also,&nbsp;<em>hocus</em>&nbsp;may mean "to cheat" in Latin or a distorted form of the word&nbsp;<em>hoc</em>, "this". Combination of the two words may give a sense, especially both meanings together "this attempt/experiment" and "cheated attempt/experiment".<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-noprint m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-Inline-Template m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-Template-Fact">[<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (December 2016)">citation needed</span></a></em>]</sup></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">According to the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oxford_English_Dictionary" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Oxford English Dictionary">Oxford English Dictionary</a>&nbsp;the term originates from&nbsp;<em>hax pax max Deus adimax</em>, a&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudo-Latin" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Pseudo-Latin">pseudo-Latin</a>&nbsp;phrase used as a&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magical_formula" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Magical formula">magical formula</a>&nbsp;by&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjuror" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Conjuror">conjurors</a>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-3"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hocus_pocus_(magic)#cite_note-3" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[3]</a></sup></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">Some believe it originates from a corruption or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parody" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Parody">parody</a>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_liturgy" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Catholic liturgy">Catholic liturgy</a>&nbsp;of the&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eucharist_(Catholic_Church)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Eucharist (Catholic Church)">Eucharist</a>, which contains the phrase "<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Words_of_Institution" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Words of Institution">Hoc est corpus meum</a></em>", meaning&nbsp;<em>This is my body</em>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-4"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hocus_pocus_(magic)#cite_note-4" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[4]</a></sup>This explanation goes back to speculations by the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_of_England" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Church of England">Anglican</a>&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prelate" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Prelate">prelate</a>&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Tillotson" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="John Tillotson">John Tillotson</a>, who wrote in 1694:</span><br />
<blockquote class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-templatequote">
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">In all probability those common juggling words of&nbsp;<em>hocus pocus</em>&nbsp;are nothing else but a corruption of&nbsp;<em>hoc est corpus</em>, by way of ridiculous imitation of the priests of the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholic_Church" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Catholic Church">Church of Rome</a>&nbsp;in their trick of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transubstantiation" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Transubstantiation">Transubstantiation</a>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-5"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hocus_pocus_(magic)#cite_note-5" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[5</a></sup></span></blockquote>
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">This claim is substantiated by the fact that in the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netherlands" rel="noopener" target="_blank" <span style="font-size: xx-small;">A&nbsp;<strong>hero</strong>&nbsp;(masculine) or&nbsp;<strong>heroine</strong>&nbsp;(feminine) is a person or main character of a literary work who, in the face of danger, combats adversity through impressive feats of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ingenuity" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ingenuity">ingenuity</a>,&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bravery" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Bravery">bravery</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Physical_strength" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Physical strength">stren<wbr></wbr>gth</a>, often sacrificing their own personal concerns for a&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Value_theory" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Value theory">greater good</a>.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The concept of the hero was first founded in&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classical_literature" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Classical literature">classical literature</a>. It is the main or revered character in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epic_poetry" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Epic poetry">heroic epic poetry</a>&nbsp;celebrated through&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Legends" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ancient Legends">ancient legends</a>&nbsp;of a people; often striving for military conquest and living by a continually flawed personal honor code.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-:02_1-0"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hero#cite_note-:02-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup>&nbsp;The definition of a hero has changed throughout time, and the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Webster%27s_Dictionary" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Webster's Dictionary">Merriam Webster</a>&nbsp;dictionary defines a hero as "a person who is admired for great or brave acts or fine qualities".<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-2"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hero#cite_note-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup>&nbsp;Examples of heroes range from mythological figures, such as&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gilgamesh" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Gilgamesh">Gilgamesh</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Achilles" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Achilles">Achilles</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iphigenia" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Iphigenia">Iph<wbr></wbr>igenia</a>, to historical figures, such as&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joan_of_Arc" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Joan of Arc">Joan of Arc</a>, modern heroes like&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alvin_York" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Alvin York">Alvin York</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Audie_Murphy" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Audie Murphy">Audie Murphy</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chuck_Yeager" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Chuck Yeager">Chuck Yeager</a>&nbsp;and fictional&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superheroes" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Superheroes">superheroes</a>&nbsp;includin<wbr></wbr>g&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Superman">Superman</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batman" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Batman">Batman</a>.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;"><strong>Truth</strong>&nbsp;is most often used to mean being in accord with&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fact" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Fact">fact</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reality" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Reality">reality</a>,<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-Merriam-Webster-def_1-0"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truth#cite_note-Merriam-Webster-def-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup>&nbsp;or fidelity to an original or standard.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-Merriam-Webster-def_1-1"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truth#cite_note-Merriam-Webster-def-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup>&nbsp;Truth may also often be used in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modernity" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Modernity">modern</a>&nbsp;contexts to refer to an idea of "truth to self," or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Authenticity_(philosophy)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Authenticity (philosophy)">authenticity</a>.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The commonly understood&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principle_of_bivalence" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Principle of bivalence">opposite</a>&nbsp;of truth is&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Falsity" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Falsity">falsehood</a>, which, correspondingly, can also take on a logical, factual, or ethical meaning. The&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Concept" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Concept">concept</a>&nbsp;of truth is discussed and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debate" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Debate">debated</a>&nbsp;in several contexts, including philosophy, art, and religion. Many human activities depend upon the concept, where its nature as a concept is assumed rather than being a subject of discussion; these include most (but not all) of the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Science">sciences</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Law">law</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Journalism" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Journalism">journalism</a>, and everyday life. Some philosophers view the concept of truth as basic, and unable to be explained in any terms that are more easily understood than the concept of truth itself. Commonly, truth is viewed as the correspondence of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Language" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Language">language</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thought" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Thought">thought</a>&nbsp;to an independent&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reality" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Reality">reality</a>, in what is sometimes called the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Correspondence_theory_of_truth" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Correspondence theory of truth">correspondence theory of truth</a>.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">Other philosophers take this common meaning to be secondary and derivative. According to&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Heidegger" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Martin Heidegger">Martin Heidegger</a>, the original meaning and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Essence" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Essence">essence</a>&nbsp;of truth in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Greece" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ancient Greece">Ancient Greece</a>&nbsp;was unconcealment, or the revealing or bringing of what was previously hidden into the open, as indicated by the original Greek term for truth,&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aletheia" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Aletheia">aletheia</a></em>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-2"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truth#cite_note-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup><sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-3"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truth#cite_note-3" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[3]</a></sup>&nbsp;On this view, the conception of truth as correctness is a later derivation from the concept's original essence, a development Heidegger traces to the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Latin">Latin</a>&nbsp;term&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veritas" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Veritas">veritas</a></em>.</span></div>

<center>
<span class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-">  <div style="text-align: justify; width: 500px;">
<div dir="auto">
<span style="font-size: xx-small;"><strong>Lothario</strong>&nbsp;is a male given name which came to suggest an unscrupulous seducer of women in&nbsp;<em>The Impertinent Curious Man</em>, a&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Story_within_a_story" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Story within a story">metastory</a>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Quixote" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Don Quixote">Don Quixote</a></em>.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">For no particular reason, Anselmo decides to test the fidelity of his wife, Camilla, and asks his friend, Lothario, to seduce her. Thinking that to be madness, Lothario reluctantly agrees, and soon reports to Anselmo that Camilla is a faithful wife. Anselmo learns that Lothario has lied and attempted no seduction. He makes Lothario promise to try for real and leaves town to make this easier. Lothario tries and Camilla writes letters to her husband telling him and asking him to return; Anselmo makes no reply and does not return. Lothario actually falls in love and Camilla eventually reciprocates and their affair continues once Anselmo returns.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">One day, Lothario sees a man leaving Camilla's house and jealously presumes she has found another lover. He tells Anselmo he has at last been successful and arranges a time and place for Anselmo to see the seduction. Before this rendezvous, Lothario learns that the man was actually the lover of Camilla's maid. He and Camilla contrive to deceive Anselmo further: when Anselmo watches them, she refuses Lothario, protests her love for her husband, and stabs herself lightly in the breast. With Anselmo reassured of her fidelity, the affair restarts with him none the wiser.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;"><strong>Romeo Montague</strong>&nbsp;(<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_language" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Italian language">Italian</a>:&nbsp;<span lang="it"><em>Romeo Montecchi</em></span>) is the protagonist of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Shakespeare" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="William Shakespeare">William Shakespeare</a>'s&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tragedy" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Tragedy">tragedy</a>&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romeo_and_Juliet" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Romeo and Juliet">Romeo and Juliet</a></em>. The son of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Characters_in_Romeo_and_Juliet#Montague" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Characters in Romeo and Juliet">Montague</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Characters_in_Romeo_and_Juliet#Montague.27s_wife" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Characters in Romeo and Juliet">his wife</a>, he secretly loves and marries&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juliet" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Juliet">Juliet</a>, a member of the rival House of Capulet. Forced into exile after slaying Juliet's cousin,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tybalt" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Tybalt">Tybalt</a>, in a&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duel" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Duel">duel</a>, Romeo commits&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suicide" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Suicide">suicide</a>&nbsp;upon hearing falsely of Juliet's death.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The character's origins can be traced as far back as&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyramus" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Pyramus">Pyramus</a>, who appears in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ovid" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ovid">Ovid</a>'s&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metamorphoses" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Metamorphoses">Metamorphoses</a></em>, but the first modern incarnation of Romeo is Mariotto in the 33rd of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masuccio_Salernitano" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Masuccio Salernitano">Masuccio Salernitano</a>'s&nbsp;<em>Il Novellino</em>&nbsp;(1476). This story was adapted by&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luigi_da_Porto" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Luigi da Porto">Luigi da Porto</a>&nbsp;as&nbsp;<em>Giulietta e Romeo</em>&nbsp;(1530), and Shakespeare's main source was an&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tragical_History_of_Romeus_and_Juliet" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="The Tragical History of Romeus and Juliet">English verse translation</a>&nbsp;of this text by&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Brooke_(poet)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Arthur Brooke (poet)">Arthur&nbsp;</a></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The earliest tale bearing a resemblance to Shakespeare's&nbsp;<em>Romeo and Juliet</em>&nbsp;is&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xenophon_of_Ephesus" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Xenophon of Ephesus">Xenophon of Ephesus</a>'&nbsp;<em><a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephesiaca" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ephesiaca">Ephesiaca</a></em>, whose hero is a&nbsp;<span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;">Habrocomes</span><span style="font-family: sans-serif;">. The character of Romeo is also similar to that of&nbsp;</span><a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pyramus" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Pyramus">Pyramus</a><span style="font-family: sans-serif;">&nbsp;in&nbsp;</span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ovid" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ovid">Ovid</a><span style="font-family: sans-serif;">'s&nbsp;</span><em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metamorphoses" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Metamorphoses">Metamorph<wbr></wbr>oses</a></em><span style="font-family: sans-serif;">, a youth who is unable to meet the object of his affection due to an ancient family quarrel, and later kills himself due to mistakenly believing her to have been dead.</span><sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-Halio_2-0"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romeo#cite_note-Halio-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup><span style="font-family: sans-serif;">&nbsp;Although it is unlikely that Shakespeare directly borrowed from Ovid</span></span><br />

<h4>
<span style="font-size: xx-small;"><span class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-headline" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-Abbreviations">Abbreviations</span><span class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-editsection"><span class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="https://en.wiktionary.org/w/index.php?title=as_fuck&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Edit section: Abbreviations">edit</a><span class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></span></h4>
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">In&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norse_religion" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Norse religion">Norse religion</a>,&nbsp;<strong>Asgard</strong>&nbsp;(<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Norse_language" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Old Norse language">Old Norse</a>:&nbsp;<span lang="non"><em>Ásgarðr</em></span>; "Enclosure of the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%86sir" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Æsir">Æsir</a>"<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-LINDOW_1-0"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asgard#cite_note-LINDOW-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup>) is one of the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norse_cosmology" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Norse cosmology">Nine Worlds</a>&nbsp;and home to the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%86sir" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Æsir">Æsir</a>&nbsp;tribe of&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norse_gods" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Norse gods">gods</a>. It is surrounded by an incomplete wall attributed to a&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hrimthurs" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Hrimthurs">Hrimthurs</a>&nbsp;riding the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stallion" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Stallion">stallion</a>&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sva%C3%B0ilfari" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Svaðilfari">Svaðilfari</a>, according to&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gylfaginning" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Gylfaginning">Gylfaginning</a></em>.&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odin" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Odin">Odin</a>and his wife,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frigg" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Frigg">Frigg</a>, are the rulers of Asgard.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">One of Asgard's well known realms is&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Valhalla" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Valhalla">Valhalla</a>, in which Odin rules.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-2"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asgard#cite_note-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">rods, etc.) and sizes, and are normally held rigidly within some form of matrix or body until the&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High_explosive" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="High explosive">high explosive</a>&nbsp;(HE) filling is detonated. The resulting high-velocity fragments produced by either method are the main lethal mechanisms of these weapons, rather than the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Heat">heat</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Overpressure" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Overpressure">overpressure</a>&nbsp;cause<wbr></wbr>d by detonation, although&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grenade#Concussion" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Grenade">offensive grenades</a>&nbsp;are often constructed without a frag matrix.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">These casing pieces are often incorrectly referred to as "<strong>shrapnel</strong>"<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-shrapneldef_1-0"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fragmentation_(weaponry)#cite_note-shrapneldef-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup><sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-2"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fragmentation_(weaponry)#cite_note-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup>&nbsp;(particularly by non-military media sources).</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The modern&nbsp;<strong>torpedo</strong>&nbsp;is a self-propelled weapon with an explosive&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warhead" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Warhead">warhead</a>, launched above or below the water surface, propelled underwater towards a target, and designed to detonate either on contact with its target or in proximity to it.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">Historically, it was called an automotive, automobile, locomotive or fish torpedo; colloquially called a&nbsp;<em>fish</em>. The term&nbsp;<em>torpedo</em>&nbsp;was originally employed for a variety of devices, most of which would today be called&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_mine" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Naval mine">mines</a>. From about 1900,&nbsp;<em>torpedo</em>&nbsp;has been used strictly to designate an underwater self-propelled weapon.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">While the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battleship" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Battleship">battleship</a>&nbsp;had evolved primarily around engagements between armoured ships with&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_artillery" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Naval artillery">large-caliber guns</a>, the torpedo allowed&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torpedo_boat" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Torpedo boat">torpedo boats</a>&nbsp;and other lighter surface ships,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Submarine" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Submarine">submersibles</a>, even ordinary fish</span><br />

<span style="font-size: xx-small;">The term&nbsp;<strong>Golden Age</strong>&nbsp;comes from&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_mythology" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Greek mythology">Greek mythology</a>, particularly the&nbsp;<em><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Works_and_Days" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Works and Days">Works and Days</a></em>&nbsp;of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hesiod" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Hesiod">Hesiod</a>, and is part of the description of temporal decline of the state of peoples through five&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ages_of_Man" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ages of Man">Ages</a>, Gold being the first and the one during which the Golden Race of humanity (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_language" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Greek language">Greek</a>:&nbsp;<span lang="el">χρύσεον γένος</span>&nbsp;<em>chrýseon génos</em>)<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-1"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age#cite_note-1" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[1]</a></sup>&nbsp;lived. Those living in the first Age were ruled by&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cronus" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Cronus">Kronos</a>, after the finish of the first age was the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silver_age" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Silver age">Silver</a>, then the&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bronze_Age_(mythology)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Bronze Age (mythology)">Bronze</a>, after this the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_Heroic_Age" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Greek Heroic Age">Heroic</a>&nbsp;age, with the fifth and current age being&nbsp;<a class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-mw-redirect" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Age_(mythology)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Iron Age (mythology)">Iron</a>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-2"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age#cite_note-2" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[2]</a></sup></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">By extension "Golden Age" denotes a period of primordial&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peace" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Peace">peace</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmony" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Harmony">harmony</a>,&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecological_stability" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Ecological stability">sta<wbr></wbr>bility</a>, and&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosperity" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Prosperity">prosperity</a>. During this age peace and harmony prevailed, people did not have to work to feed themselves, for the earth provided food in abundance. They lived to a very old age with a youthful appearance, eventually dying peacefully, with spirits living on as "guardians".&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plato" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Plato">Plato</a>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cratylus_(dialogue)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Cratylus (dialogue)">Cratylus</a><wbr></wbr>&nbsp;(397 e) recounts the golden race of humans who came first. He clarifies that Hesiod did not mean literally made of gold, but good and noble.</span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">There are analogous concepts in the religious and philosophical traditions of the South Asian subcontinent. For example, the&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vedas" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Vedas">Vedic</a>&nbsp;or ancient&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hindu" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Hindu">Hindu</a>&nbsp;culture saw history as cyclical, composed of&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuga" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Yuga">yugas</a>&nbsp;with alternating Dark and Golden Ages. The Kali yuga (Iron Age), Dwapara yuga (Bronze Age), Treta yuga (Silver Age) and Satya yuga (Golden Age) correspond to the four Greek ages. Similar beliefs occur in the ancient&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_East" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Middle East">Middle East</a>&nbsp;and throughout the ancient world, as well.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-3"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age#cite_note-3" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[3]</a></sup></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">In classical Greek mythology the Golden Age was presided over by the leading&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titan_(mythology)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Titan (mythology)">Titan</a>&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cronus" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Cronus">Cronus</a>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-4"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age#cite_note-4" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[4]</a></sup>&nbsp;In some version of the myth&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astraea_(mythology)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Astraea (mythology)">Astraea</a>&nbsp;also ruled. She lived with men until the end of the Silver Age, but in the Bronze Age, when men became violent and greedy, fled to the stars, where she appears as the constellation&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virgo_(constellation)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Virgo (constellation)">Virgo</a>, holding the scales of Justice, or&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Libra_(constellation)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Libra (constellation)">Libra</a>.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-5"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age#cite_note-5" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[5]</a></sup></span><br />
<span style="font-size: xx-small;">European&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pastoral" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Pastoral">pastoral</a>&nbsp;literary tradition often depicted nymphs and shepherds as living a life of rustic innocence and peace, set in&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arcadia_(utopia)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Arcadia (utopia)">Arcadia</a>, a region of Greece that was the abode and center of worship of their tutelary deity, goat-footed&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pan_(god)" rel="noopener" target="_blank" title="Pan (god)">Pan</a>, who dwelt among them.<sup class="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-reference" id="m_158975033028017888gmail-m_-8331878344170685664gmail-m_5764344300076887091gmail-m_-4833942028542663904gmail-m_-8252426390011619265gmail-cite_ref-6"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Age#cite_note-6" rel="noopener" target="_blank">[6]</a></sup></span></div>
</div>
</span></center>

That's not sarcasm, these things are actually difficult to guess how exactly we'll go about doing them; they are a huge deal--all I can tell you is that not "talking about it at all" is probably not going to get us there any faster.&nbsp; Point in fact, what it might do is give a "yet to be born" generation the privilege of being the actual "generations of Perez."&nbsp;&nbsp;</div>
<div>
<br /></div>
<div>
</div>
<div>
I see why you aren't saying anything.&nbsp; That's sarcasm, again.&nbsp; &nbsp;The good news is that it&nbsp;<a href="http://doors.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">really ha</a>s been done before; though if I told you that&nbsp;<a href="http://doors.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">someone turned stone to eggplant parm</a>, would you laugh at me?</div>
</div>
</center>
</div>

<div style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px; text-align: center;">

<div style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px;">
<br /></div>
<center style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px;">
<div style="text-align: justify; width: 500px;">
So, back to what is actually standing between "everyone having their own Holodeck in the sky" and you today; it is the idea that this message is not from God.&nbsp; More to the point it is the apparently broad sweeping opinion that hiding it is a "good thing" and through that&nbsp;<a href="http://valentine.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">a global failure to address the hidden interaction and influence</a>&nbsp;acting on our minds&nbsp;<strong>used to make this map--and also to hide it</strong>.&nbsp; &nbsp;With some insight, and some urging; you might see how&nbsp;<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">the sacredness of our consciousness&nbsp;<em>is our souls</em></a>&nbsp;is something that is more fundamental than "what kind of tools we have in the Holodeck to magically build things" and how and why the foundation of Heaven is truly "freedom itself" and how it comes from&nbsp;<em>right this very moment</em>&nbsp;for the first time, ever.&nbsp; Continuing to treat this influence as "schizophrenia" is literally the heart of why this map appears to be that--to show us how important it is to acknowledge the truth, and to fight for the preservation of goodness and logic over secrecy and darkness.</div>
</center>
<div style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px; text-align: center;">
</div>
<div style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px; text-align: center;">

<div style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px; text-align: center;">
<br /></div>
<div style="background-color: white; color: #292929; font-family: lora, serif; font-size: 20px;">
<center>
<div style="text-align: justify; width: 500px;">
<div>
Again, something that nobody is really doing here and now, today.&nbsp; From this newfound protection of our thoughts, of who we are; we see how technology can be used to either&nbsp;<a href="http://gate.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">completely invalidate any kind of vote by altering our emotions; or how it could be used to help build a form of true democracy</a>&nbsp;that our world has yet to see.&nbsp; It is pretty easy to see from just band names like&nbsp;<a href="http://who.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">The Who</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://bereshit.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">KISS</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">The Cure</a>&nbsp;how the influence of this external mind can be proven, and shown to be "helpful," you know,&nbsp;<em><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9Dg-g7t2l4" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">if we can ever talk about it on TV</a>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<a href="http://confession.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">on the internet</a>.</em></div>
<div>
</div>
</div>
</center>

<div style="text-align: justify; width: 500px;">
<em>It's important to see and understand how "<a href="http://valentine.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">sanity</a>"--the sanity&nbsp;<a href="http://ender.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">of our entire planet</a>&nbsp;hangs in the balance over whether or not we acknowledge that there is actually a message from God&nbsp;<a href="http://tada.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">in every word</a>--and today this place appears to be insane.&nbsp;&nbsp;</em>It should be pretty easy to see how acknowledging that this influence exists and that it has&nbsp;<a href="http://ender.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">a technological mechanism</a>&nbsp;behind it turns "<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">schizophrenia</a>" into "<a href="http://bygod.whenistheapocalypse.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">I know kung fu</a>" ... forced&nbsp;<a href="http://meth.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">drug addiction</a>&nbsp;and eugenics into&nbsp;<em>"<a href="http://who.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">there's an app for that</a>"&nbsp;</em>and the rash of non random and apparently&nbsp;<a href="http://don.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">unrecognized as connected terrorist attacks and school shootings</a>&nbsp;into&nbsp;<a href="http://don.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">Minority</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://serden.reallyhim.com/" rel="noopener" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">Report style pre-crime</a>&nbsp;and results in what is clearly a happier, safer, and more civilized society--all through nothing more than the disclosure of the truth, this map, and our actual implementation.</div>

<div style="text-align: justify; width: 500px;">
<div>
With a clearer head and grasp of the "big picture" you might see how all of these things, connected to the Plagues of Exodus revolve around the disclosure that this technology exists and the visibility of this message showing us how we might use it for our benefit rather than not knowing about it.&nbsp; At the foot of Jericho, it is nothing short of "sanity" and "free thought" that hang in the balance.&nbsp; Clear to me is that the Second Coming, seeing "<a href="http://name.lamc.la/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">my name</a>" on television is a good litmus test for the dividing line between light and darkness, heaven and hell.</div>
<div>

<div>
</div>
<div>
The point is the truth really does change everything for the better; once we start... you know, acting on it.</div>

<span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: xx-small;"><strong>Yeshua</strong>&nbsp;(<span lang="he">ישוע</span>, with vowel pointing&nbsp;<span lang="he">יֵשׁוּעַ</span>&nbsp;–&nbsp;<em>yēšūă'</em>&nbsp;in&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=3657070c-2b1a-49f4-946f-91e2af31437a&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Hebrew language"><wbr></wbr>Hebrew</a>) was a common alternative form of the name&nbsp;<span lang="he">יְהוֹשֻׁעַ</span>&nbsp;("Yehoshua" –&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=3a1ae303-dd85-4b19-a620-9d2cb31a50ee&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Joshua">Joshua</a>) in later books of the&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=80b21fc6-ea42-4c4a-ace9-048a080d163f&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Hebrew Bible">Hebrew Bible</a>&nbsp;and among Jews of the&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=5c5af4a8-d530-4aa6-b2e0-6c3cc718069b&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Second Temple period">Second Temple period</a>. The name corresponds to the Greek spelling&nbsp;<em>Iesous</em>, from which, through the Latin&nbsp;<em>Iesus</em>, comes the English spelling&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=8a8f7c2e-a8ab-4b17-a8c5-63adfeaa1c83&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; <span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: xx-small;"><br /></span><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: xx-small;">The Hebrew spelling&nbsp;<em>Yeshua</em>&nbsp;(ישוע) appears in some later books of the Hebrew Bible. Once for&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=551bc716-30bd-42dd-978f-842ec4cd8af3&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Joshua">Joshua</a>&nbsp;the son of Nun, and 28 times for&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=9084ff62-63cf-4c67-8415-58c0912d5424&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Joshua the High Priest">Joshua the High Priest</a>&nbsp;and (<a class="m_335559167484459286m_-2462594541108499772gmail-m_-1644936308594193845gmail-m_-1425260696292380041m_-6606627327515452666m_6605744291038607384m_-1341156577359935856m_1143141077132377639m_5371528777137425371m_7312233276763737620gmail-m_-7699896603790004333gmail-m_2515164250424317772gmail-mw-redirect" href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=a0fa1cb8-7dd7-417c-bd5c-88a2448340a2&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="KJV">KJV</a>"Jeshua") and other priests called Jeshua – although these same priests are also given the spelling Joshua in 11 further instances in the books of&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=165d9d81-014c-44f4-8a98-b531ac5a8233&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Book of Haggai">Haggai</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=2d9af4c6-5050-4fe9-ae2d-7d04a346bc3f&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Book of Zechariah">Zechariah</a>. It differs from the usual Hebrew Bible spelling of&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=551bc716-30bd-42dd-978f-842ec4cd8af3&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Joshua">Joshua</a>&nbsp;(יְהוֹשֻׁעַ&nbsp;<em>y'hoshua<wbr></wbr>ʿ</em>), found 218 times in the Hebrew Bible, in the absence of the consonant&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=5a2f00c1-4ee8-4777-a8f9-b30c2cc9b1d1&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="He (letter)">he ה</a>&nbsp;and placement of the semivowel&nbsp;<a class="m_335559167484459286m_-2462594541108499772gmail-m_-1644936308594193845gmail-m_-1425260696292380041m_-6606627327515452666m_6605744291038607384m_-1341156577359935856m_1143141077132377639m_5371528777137425371m_7312233276763737620gmail-m_-7699896603790004333gmail-m_2515164250424317772gmail-mw-redirect" href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=3256a576-7e4d-4dca-afd9-dd7ddb69912f&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Vav (letter)">vav</a>&nbsp;ו after, not before, the consonant&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=34626771-8c8d-4c04-bf5c-2902963d794e&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Shin (letter)">shin ש</a>. color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Book of Genesis">Book of Genesis</a>.<span class="m_335559167484459286m_-2462594541108499772gmail-m_-1644936308594193845gmail-m_-1425260696292380041m_-6606627327515452666m_6605744291038607384m_-1341156577359935856m_1143141077132377639m_5371528777137425371m_7312233276763737620gmail-m_-7699896603790004333gmail-reference" id="m_335559167484459286m_-2462594541108499772gmail-m_-1644936308594193845gmail-m_-1425260696292380041m_-6606627327515452666m_6605744291038607384m_-1341156577359935856m_1143141077132377639m_5371528777137425371m_7312233276763737620gmail-m_-7699896603790004333gmail-cite_ref-Gruenwald_2003_1-0" style="font-size: 9px; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">[1]</a></span>&nbsp;The etymological link between the word adamah and the word&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=cc764699-3d7d-4d08-af50-27b3e63ac304&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Teleology">teleological</a>&nbsp;link between&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=451c5470-d2c5-4f28-9d6c-4ec033d0edc8&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank" title="Human">humankind</a>&nbsp;and the ground, emphasising both the way in which man was created to cultivate the world, and how he originated from the&nbsp;<a href="http://input_requred.telesprize.technocrazy.gq/x/c?c=1670373&amp;l=97015b9e-05a7-42f1-8de9-2af0ac5c36a0&amp;r=1d57efe1-69f3-4b63-bee1-3ebfc6f8ae5e" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">&nbsp;</a>we are&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2hNeOE0" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">looking at</a>&nbsp;in the world around us, from secrecy and mind control to censorship and .. well, mass stupidity--should really be seen for what it is--it is the crossing of the sea,&nbsp;</span><strong>a lesson in securing and maintaining liberty.</strong></em></div>
<div dir="ltr">
<em><strong><span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;"><br /></span></strong></em></div>
<div>
<span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif; font-style: italic; font-weight: bold;">Acknowledge&nbsp;</span><i style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif;">that you do not want to eat "</i><a href="http://bit.ly/2h1Gyzh" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-style: italic;" target="_blank">bread</a><i style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif;">" from stone, that "</i><a href="http://bit.ly/2ha4H70" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-style: italic;" target="_blank">cake</a><i style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif;">" is not good enough either, and that&nbsp;</i><a href="http://bit.ly/2xoKvuG" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-style: italic;" target="_blank">God has laid down a message in our&nbsp;<b>everything</b></a><i style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif;">&nbsp;to help us to transition to a world that does not shake it's head and look the other way when asked the question "how would you end world hunger"&nbsp;</i><b style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, serif; font-style: italic;">in light of virtual reality? &nbsp;</b><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;">Understand the words of "Total Eclipse of the Heart"&nbsp;</span><i><span style="font-family: &quot;arial narrow&quot; , sans-serif;"><a href="http://bit.ly/2h2DCTh" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">we'll never be wrong together, forever is going to start tonight</a></span><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;">. Understand, this is something that all of you should really want to be a part of, and I am baffled as to&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2gWb82X" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">why</a>&nbsp;you are so shy as to not even be able to&nbsp;<b>say</b>&nbsp;<b><a href="http://bit.ly/2xnCdTJ" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">hello</a></b>.</span></i></div>
<div dir="ltr">
</div>
<div>
<span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;"><em>This is a sort of compilation of several messages, if you can't tell; you can see the "originals" and subscribe to the secret pizza party once we all get to&nbsp;</em><a href="http://bit.ly/2gZghlk" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><strong>Atlantis</strong></a><em>&nbsp;at the Google group&nbsp;</em><a href="http://bit.ly/2gUrLw2" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><strong>light</strong>.reallyhim.com</a><em>&nbsp;and/<wbr></wbr>or my&nbsp;</em><a href="http://bit.ly/2gVzkTq" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><strong>slack</strong>.reallyhim.com</a><em>.&nbsp; Ask anything,&nbsp;</em><strong>honestly. &nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;What follows is the gate to Heaven, and&nbsp;<em>I&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2xnby9z" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><strong>do</strong></a><span style="color: white;">n</span>mean&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2gUz07l" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><strong>kiss</strong>ing</a>&nbsp;me.&nbsp; Here's my&nbsp;<strong>cough</strong>, CY the apocalypse starts with a "sex joke" have a gander at the&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2gUs3D8" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">Burning&nbsp;<strong>Bush</strong></a>, and the&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2xnshJQ" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><strong>Loch</strong>&nbsp;Ness Monster</a>.</em></span></div>
<div>
<span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;"><em><br /></em></span></div>
<div>
<em><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;">I'm not sure&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2gZghlk" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">what I could possibly be offering to everyone</a>&nbsp;you in exchange for being the person that saves the Universe from darkness--it will without doubt make you one of the most, if not the most famous&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: &quot;comic sans ms&quot; , sans-serif;">person&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;">that's ever lived.&nbsp; On top of that you are lucky enough to all be in sea of founders of this thing--this&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2h1CUWe" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">planet<b>ah</b></a>&nbsp;built from ground up to turn Hell into Heaven.&nbsp; It's probably a good place to be, at the beginning of what the future will certainly see as the great turning point away from darkness, as the generations that turned absolutely everything around.&nbsp; Welcome to the spotlight, heart of all Creation.</span></em></div>
<div>
<em><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;"><br /></span></em></div>

<div>
<em><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;"><br /></span></em></div>
<div>
<em><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;">I could tell you that "the truth will set you free" but clearly you now see the truth, and that we need more than just "truth" to secure and protect freedom; we need&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2gUX3mH" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank"><b>you</b></a>. &nbsp;</span></em><em><span style="font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;">Try to see the<a href="http://bit.ly/2gUz0nR" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">gate and the plan</a>&nbsp;the way I do--every person you speak about this with and share this e-mail with brings us that much closer,&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2xnJ67I" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">another day</a>&nbsp;closer, to an eternity of&nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/2gZghlk" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer; font-family: arial, sans-serif;" target="_blank">Heaven</a>.</span></em></div>

About a week ago I was having a casual conversation about&nbsp;<a href="http://doors.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank"><span style="font-family: &quot;comic sans ms&quot; , sans-serif;">what</span>&nbsp;"Doors"</a>&nbsp;mean to me with someone who works at the rehab facility I was staying at--and pretty much out of nowhere he "guessed" something related to&nbsp;<em>a day trip to Heaven</em>--not really being pejorative or negative, but just from hearing only those words and&nbsp;<span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;">no why&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , sans-serif;">it's pretty obvious that's not a "good thing."&nbsp; It's probably not a "good thing" that there's a general "air" of poorly informed talk about who I am and what I am trying to deliver to the world--that someone who was nowhere near me while I was writing could possibly know something so specific about this message, and&nbsp;<em>really not understand why.</em>&nbsp; So I explained it to him, and I'm going to explain it to you also, now.</span></div>

<div>
<span style="font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , sans-serif;">To tell you the truth, if I could have my way I'd have put Doors to Heaven in every bus station already, and leave them there--that frankly is what I believe is the obvious end result of the disclosure that&nbsp;<em>we are a small room</em>&nbsp;in a large "virtual reality" mansion; but doing something that drastic would change things too quickly, and probably cause a significant disruption to the "stuff of civilization" -- like people driving to work -- which is something that we are specifically designed here in this place to ensure does not happen as a result of this disclosure.&nbsp;&nbsp;<em>Medicine</em>&nbsp;is a more significant example of "why it is" that it's a "</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;">mid</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , sans-serif;">" and not a "</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;">min</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , sans-serif;">" -- and really do see that you are listening to the person that our folklore and our modern art describe as some sort of fusion between Kaleb, Cerberus, and&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;">Max</span><span style="font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , sans-serif;">--who is the Grinch's dog.&nbsp; From the "spy of Heaven" to the person before you telling you that "<strong><em>Kaleb</em></strong>&nbsp;means dog" you really should see some "light" in my suggestion that Hades three headed hellhound is connected to the gatekeeper Jesus Christ and also the Holy Trinity--in a sort of pejorative "<em>honestly</em>&nbsp;<a href="http://hammer.lamc.la/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">I'm</a>&nbsp;not&nbsp;<a href="http://hadragonbreath.blogspot.com/2017/09/ha-lot-are-idaho.html" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">Idaho</a>" kind of way.&nbsp; &nbsp;There's a&nbsp;<em>sickness here</em>, and whatever it is that is keeping this very ostentatious message out of the news and in our "telephone-gamed" minds is a symptom of a&nbsp;<a href="http://loch.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">much larger mind control problem</a>&nbsp;that this message is designed to help save us from, and then help us help save the Universe from.&nbsp; Tying this paragraph up, you can see the&nbsp;<strong>min/max/mid</strong>&nbsp;<em>religion of the disclosure</em>&nbsp;in everything from an eponymous Egyptian God to James Clerk&nbsp;<strong>Max</strong>well and&nbsp;<strong>Mid</strong>gard--which is you--literatally and Adamically.</span><br />

My initial reason for the "day trip to Heaven" was to help us&nbsp;<em>break the veil of simulated reality</em>--an idea that began with the fabled "<span style="font-family: &quot;comic sans ms&quot; , sans-serif;">write it on the sky</span>" of Captain&nbsp;<a href="http://threetag.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">EO + King David</a>&nbsp;(see&nbsp;<em><a href="http://heart.lamc.la/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">davideo</a>(s)</em>) that has turned into some very clear proof that we have a ridiculous&nbsp;<a href="http://chalk.realyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">censorship p</a>roblem,&nbsp;<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">and a prob</a>le<a href="http://ham.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">m</a>&nbsp;<a href="http://valentine.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">telling the truth about mind control</a>--something we wouldn't see at all if it was "written on the sky" day one... and today looking back we can probably see that helps us to find out what Heaven really means--a place of freedom and free communication that comes of this "press" of society here to see just how very important&nbsp;<strong><a href="http://fb.me/admdbrn" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">the truth</a></strong>&nbsp;actually is.</div>
<div style="text-align: center;">

Still, we not only&nbsp;<a href="http://threetag.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">need to break the veil o</a>f "reality" but we need to do it in a happy uplifiting way that helps the world to see how this disclosure will inevitably help us solve real problems--not just&nbsp;<a href="http://chalk.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">censorship</a>&nbsp;and the com<a href="http://gate.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">plete hidden destruction of democra</a>cy--problems like "<a href="http://bereshit.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">hunger</a>" and "<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">cancer</a>" and "<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">insanity</a>" and also problems like the idiotic belief that we&nbsp;<span style="font-family: &quot;comic sans ms&quot; , sans-serif;">hav<a href="http://doors.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">e to di</a>e</span>&nbsp;to get to Heaven.<br />

We do need to see that just like mechanical automation in factories the addition of new&nbsp;<span style="font-family: &quot;comic sans ms&quot; , sans-serif;">medicines</span>&nbsp;for&nbsp;<a href="http://who.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">curing maladies like&nbsp;<strong>blindness</strong></a>&nbsp;will inevitably result in the loss of jobs for auto line workers and optometrists, and luckily we have many&nbsp;<a href="http://doors.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">new opportunities</a>&nbsp;available in the transitionary world between Earth and Heaven that we are actually well within at this point.&nbsp; Just like&nbsp;<a href="http://loch.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">Mionster.com</a>&nbsp;and Facebook's Jupiter that serves the same purpose; we're going to need help altering our social fabric to better handle&nbsp;<a href="http://cure.reallyhim.com/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">things like immortality</a>&nbsp;and the need for a mid-life change in "job function" becoming significantly more normal.&nbsp; So this is why "<strong>mid</strong>" rather than "min" ... it's because&nbsp;<em>you actually need to do something to help change the world--you can't just sit around and torture me for telling you that I refuse to do it for you.</em></div>

<em><br /></em></div>

You probably don't see it; but compared to our time, the society in Heaven probably views us as something like cave-men--and you see that in the time dilated description of our "today" that is actually both the Old and New Testaments.&nbsp; There's probably a "culture shock" and looking at the world ... this places that appears to have leaped straight over "learning about and dealing with mind controlled slavery" to a place where people are "<span style="font-family: &quot;arial narrow&quot; , sans-serif;"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9Dg-g7t2l4" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">talking without speaking</a></span>&nbsp;in secret" and writing songs about being disturbed by Heaven's "let freedom sing" ... really missing the point that the&nbsp;<b>road</b>&nbsp;to Heaven, the&nbsp;<b><a href="http://o.lamc.la/" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">heart of A.D.</a>&nbsp;</b>is a process of adapting that comes to us with a "hand's on user manual" that you can see from our art, from things like Minority Report and Demolition Man and 1984 ... are written in a kind of "exactly what not to do" but think about how to do better, kind of way.&nbsp;&nbsp;</div>

<div style="text-align: center;">

<div>
Please think about how to do "the sound of silence" better than "Adam says we only get to go to Heaven for a day,&nbsp;<i>fuck him...&nbsp;</i>let's stay in Hell."&nbsp; The whole fucking point is that we are "<b>home</b>" and rather than dreaming about going to another place when we die--I think we should make this place into Heaven, and that's what really makes it "<b>ours</b>."</div>
<div>

<div>
While it might not be&nbsp;<b>so obvious to you</b>, from what I see around me--from the "race track" changing--it very clearly shows me that once this disclosure is made that&nbsp;<i><b><span style="font-family: &quot;arial black&quot; , sans-serif;">flu<a href="http://www.dictionary.com/browse/omniscient" style="background: transparent; color: #25a186; cursor: pointer;" target="_blank">ke</a></span></b>&nbsp;events</i>&nbsp;will magically fall into place and great things will start happening quickly; we really do need to be more concerned with&nbsp;<i>moving too fast</i>&nbsp;than too slow--once we get past "not moving at all."&nbsp; Really understand that the first "true Heaven" comes from the place that puts their foot down... and decides that&nbsp;<i>Hell simply cannot exist.</i></div>
